definition: all of one voice/unanimous
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: But between exclusivity and compromise lie consensus and ambivalence .
sentences.chinese: 但众口一词与莫衷一是就存在于排他与妥协之间。

sentences.english: The tax reform was met with unanimous applause.
sentences.chinese: 税收改革得到众口一词的称赞。

definition: (of people) to be of one voice (idiom)/unanimous
to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
lit. one-track path; fig. to adopt a unified approach to discussing an issue/to sing from the same hymn-sheet
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to denounce/to censure/to rebuke
unable to reach a decision (idiom); cannot agree on the right choice/no unanimous decision/still a matter of discussion
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to criticize/to refute
to denounce/to condemn
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
no wonder (that...)
